situation: My partner is interested in someone else and has recently began to spend more time with that person and less time with me.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Hi! how can I help you today?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I am struggling with a problem and I don't know what to do.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: what is the problem and from how long?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: My partner of 5 years is interested in someone else and has been seeing them for the past few weeks.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: that's so bad tbh , that happened to me once, I can feel you.!

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: did you talk to your partner about this?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: That's what I am struggling with. I am afraid that if I confront him, he will leave. But if I don't, this will continue and he might choose her.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: either ways if he's cheating , he will leave so why not talk to him and at least get an explanation?

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: because if you don't ask for it, you will keep overthinking about it

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: trust me that happened to me and I overthinked so much and it affected me in a negative way

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Because I'm very afraid of being alone. I almost would rather share him than risk him leaving. But my pride keeps telling me I'm worth more. The other side says, to who?

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: how old are you?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: In my 50's

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: interesting, but trust me if you don't let go, thinking about that all the time would kill you from inside.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: or just talk to him maybe he will explain ? or at least leave her?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: It is killing me. But I'm afraid. So afraid.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: don't be

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I have bent over backwards proving I'm worth living a life with while she just wants to party and spend his money.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: I feel sad for you!

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Don't feel sad, I do not want pity.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: but the only advice I would give you is that you should talk to him

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: And say what?

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: what if what you're thinking is absolutely wrong?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: What do you mean?

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: like what if that girl is his friend or cousin?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: lol, no. They go out and I hear about what they do. We have friends in common.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: oh crap

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Yeah. To top it off... her name is Barbi

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: ummmm, idk  im confused, when I was at that point I left her for cheating on me.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I'm confused too. Not about what's goin on, but about what to do with me. I know I should give him an ultimatum. But that's what puts me back at ... I'm just afraid.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: don't hang on a thread, get on one end.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: if you got any problem , just talk

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I guess I am waiting on the opportunity for a confrontation

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: what if you don't say about that anything to him and he keeps doing it and gets so close to that other girl and eventually leave you?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I know. It's almost a no win situation. Right now he would probably choose her cause she's new and fun and makes him feel young

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: so just do it then why are you waiting to get hurt

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I guess I'm thinking he'll get tired of her.. but I'm cheating myself and just losing time

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: yea

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Thank you. It helps to talk about it, although it doesn't solve the problem.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: yes but like I can't do anything about that right?

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content:
well
it was nice talking to you. :)

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Only by being a good listener, I guess

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Thank you, you too

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: yess

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: end the convo.

situation: My friend is an enabler for her addicted family members and they have taken great advantage of her.They lie, she knows it but excuses it and gives money etc behind her husband's back.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: hi

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Hello. I am so mad at my friend.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Oh no, sorry to hear. Can I hear more about it?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Her son and granddaughter are both addicted to various things - mainly drugs and alcohol. They manipulate her and she knows it but refuses to acknowledge it and do something positive.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: I am sorry to hear that. Do you mean the kids manipulate their mother, your friend?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Yes. They manipulate her. She is always giving them money without telling her husband and she is going into debt.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Sounds like a very complicated situation. I guess she wants to take care of her daughters, that is  why she gives them money. But they use the money to buy alcohol and drugs? sad isn't it?

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Drinking or using drugs does not help anything you know.  I used to drink alcohol and now I do not at all. I feel way better this way.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: It is but they are all suffering and nothing changes but she could stop the cycle by just not giving money without them being in rehab.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I'm glad you feel better.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: But it took me 20 years to get here, when I was young, I needed to drink and party.  Thank you.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Her son has done this for the last 25 years and her granddaughter started at the age of 14. Now there are 3 great-grandkids in a terrible situation but she doesn't want her son or granddaughter mad at her.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: I totally feel you. I guess all she could do is to give money to show that she cared, but it is not right. The cycle needs to change.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: They all need help.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: For college tuitions and stuff parents should help their kids but, if I give my money to my kids, I would want to track what they use my money for.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: I understand they are needing help. I hope the situation will become better. and you are such  a nice person that you worry about your friend and her family.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: They need medical and psychological help. My friend needs to stop laughing off that she is an enabler and do something before someone dies.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Got it.  Adult hospitalization programs and rehabs should certainly help. I see there is some dependency between her and her kids yes. This is a serious problem and now I am concerned about you.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: This is a serious problem and if her husband finds out what she is doing he is going to explode.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: It is hard to change people, and the situation might not change quickly. You could get hurt by seeing it. All you can do is to give advice, and maybe find a doctor or a specialists to assist her.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Wow, she has been doing that secretly.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: It is hard to change people and yes she needs help. People have to change themselves others can't change them.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Yes she has and is in debt.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Right, you can guide them in a certain way but there should be some hidden problems why those kids are always drunk and high.

situation: I was dumped by my girlfriend, and now i am depressed.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: hello how are you today?

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: are you alright?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Not doing too well.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: It is hard during the holidays without my girlfriend.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: what seems to be the problem, you know a problem shared is half solved

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I was dumped by my girlfriend, and now I am depressed and all alone.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: well it has happened to us all, the best bet is to stay close to people you love at the moment, you might be able to work things out soon

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: The problem is I am all alone during these holidays, I have no one to talk to.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: i understand that feeling, when i was all alone during a particular holiday, i focused more on  other things i love rather the ones that hurts

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Are you still alone now?  Or did you find someone in your life?

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: i did find some one and we are married over 8 years now, every disapointment could be a blessing in disguise you know

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I agree.  There is a call girl that I have been seeing off and on for 15 years, I think I want to ask her out on a date and see if she will see me without asking for money.  Fingers crossed.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: cool, if you think you love her, because it is dangerous getting into a relationship for the sake of not been lonely

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Not to mention very expensive on the pocketbook, she doesn't come cheap.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: But I think it might be love though, she loves to peg me and no one else has done that to me before, that was when I fell in love with her.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: well if it is all about money, i would suggest you find someone that cares about your heart and not your pocket

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I wish I could find both.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: just have a deep reflection and be sure it is love and not just killing being lonlely

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Yeah, I wish I wasn't lonely, but I think Sapphire might be the one for me.  And I might get to learn her real name too.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: just go for her if you are convinced. wish you  goodluck

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Thank you for your insight.  Did you say you were married for nine years?

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: over 8 years

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Congratulations.

situation: I had the best gal in the world, and i blew it with her.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: How are you?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Not feeling too hot tonight.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: I feel that i can really help you

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: How so?

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Not feeling too good, mentally?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Yes that is correct.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: These days, people feel lousy.  I know, because I have as well, but I change what I think about.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: They say that "what you think, what you become."

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I miss my girl, I blew it with her.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Girl troubles?

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: What is the crux of the problem?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: V.I. Lenin said "if you will it, it is no dream.", but what does that have to do with the price of tea in China?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: The crux of the problem is that my girl left me and my life is a mess now.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Well, the person who can articulate what they feel is the key.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Can you feel confidence to express the correct emotions to your lady friend?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: But I have no one who I can articulate these thoughts to.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: I go by the mantra,"IF there is a Will, there is a Way."

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: She knows how I feel but she doesn't care, because I am a piece of trash.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: I feel that no one soul is a "piece of trash." Only you consider yourself in the gutter. Your thoughts create your reality.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: "There are NO unimportant Lives."

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: So are you saying that I am wrong for feeling that way?

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: I am telling you that your life has meaning.  A mutual symbiosis matters.  Your better half needs to understand that.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I wish you were right.  We were going to watch Wonder Woman 1984 today together as a couple, now I have to watch it alone.  That is the real tragedy here.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: You can get on the right path by not considering yourself as "trash."

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: I can tell you that it is not a tragedy at all.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I think you are right.  It might not be as good as the first movie.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: You can reflect on a better method or way to make your lady see the light.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: I feel that you must take time to getyour better half to understand that you can change some things about you to get her to get back into a realationship with you.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Maybe I can pay her off to be with me.  That is how we got together in the first place.  She was a call girl and I tipped her a lot of money for spending the weekend with me, and she became my girl based on that.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: So, you are paying a woman to be with you? Have more pride in yourself and stop paying for it.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Your so-called girl can just find a guy who will spend more on her....until she finds an even richer man.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Then I need to spend more and more.  Thank you for the advice, I will do that now.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: I can tell you that you will end up unhappy in the longer run if you stick with that life.

situation: My friends think that i need to volunteer.They think my carpentry skills could be used to help others.They say i don't contribute enough to society with all the free time i have.They are very nagging when it comes to what i should be doing.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Hi

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Hello there

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Well, I am disgusted with my so-called friends.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: They are really disgusting me.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: I see.  When did this start?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Never thought they could be such nags.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Well, it has been going on since the Holidays began.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I just have time to be the savior of everyone's housing problems.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: By disgusting you, in what ways are they doing this?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: My two friends are in my business a lot and think I should be using my carpentry skills to build houses for free for homeless people.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I wish I had the time, but I am normally exhausted.  I am in my mid-50s and have no energy left on the weekends to allocate my time for that.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: I see and this makes you uncomfortable because if you say no they will think you are not a caring person.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Exactly. Little do they know I have a wife and kids to feed; plus, my pet parrot, Mabutu, gets upset if I don't take the bird out on a daily basis for a walk.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Well just know that you are not in the wrong here.  Believe it or not, one person should not be responsible for saving the world.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Well, my friends chide me and send me links to non-profit organizations in the area who need carpenters.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I am not sure how to handle this madness.....

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: I do have an idea that might help with this situation.  You said you own a store, how about putting a donation area around the counter?

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: In fact let them suggest to which charity and where it should go.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: No, I don't own a store. I am a carpentry contractor . I own my own small business.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Oh I see I misunderstood.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Well, Habitat for Humanity is a very popular one.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Have you heard of HFH?

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: I have.  I have actually gotten free paint from them. LOL

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Oh, ok. Well, they are saying that I need to contribute to their cause and build one house per year for them.  I wish I had more time in my life, but they are guilting me to contribute.  I just can't.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Since my suggestion can't be done, have you confronted your friends about this?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Well, they chastise me online --  not face to  face. One is a V.P. of a non-profit, too.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: What have you said back?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I try to limit any response they will jeopardize my rapport with them.  I keep telling them I am too busy. People are "thick."

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Disgust is too light a word in my situation.  More like appalled with their demeanor.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I have tried to be civil online

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Well you could take some photos of a house they were working on and say you were working on it, how would they know?  If your engagement with them is only online.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Hmmmm. Good idea.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I like that idea. I guess they would not take the time and effort to check to see if I am.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Even take some pictures of your own projects.  Say one of them is going to HFH.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: That would be really sneaky.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Surely you work on cabinets and stuff.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I am thinking of just telling them if I can't take the time, maybe they can have some of their own children take my place.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Haha

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: My two friends have grown kids, so maybe my two friends can guilt  their own family into swinging a hammer and nails.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: If you do have time in the future, it wouldn't hurt to ask if they could use a hand for something.  It just doesn't have to be now.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I know that is rude, but I could play "reverse psychology" on them.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: In the meantime, appease your friends with some props.  And be on the lookout for new friends.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Well, I need to find a way to boost my energy levels...I am just too tired on the weekends.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Whelp, I need new friends,  but they are both big wheels in the local community.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Water.  Drink lots and lots of water.  It is what we are all made of and don't drink enough of.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Maybe I can just ignore them and feel less disgusted. Peer pressure is a real drag.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: It was good talking to you.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Happy Holidays!

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Ok, well I was able to help.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: To you as well!

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Err I should say I hope I was able to help.

dialog.content: I think.

dialog.content: I am doing well. Are you ready for Christma?

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Do you have any children or anything to help occupy and distract your mind right now?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I have three children but that isn't really a distraction. Thinking about the effect this will have on them is very hard

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: I'm so sorry. You're right I can't imagine it being expected I just meant theirs is very very unexpected.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: That must be hard for you. I'm sorry

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: How long have they been married for?

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: How old are your children? I am a mom.. are they old enough to understand?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: They are 15, 13 and 11, so yes. They know everything hasn't been great.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: It's very hard to know it's coming and not have told them yet

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Since I was 2.... 25 years. They planned to renew their vows after she went to rehab. Covid made a problem she already had worse. She got home.. said she was leaving. Found out a week ago she left to be with a man she met there. My step dad is deviated but trying to be positive. I myself have been married 6 years and would be blindsided. I feel so bad for him.  He's not himself.

dialog.content: Also I am stressed about finances as I only work part time and will be supporting myself

dialog.content: He's the main one going through it. Me and my brothers feel abandoned in a way, but we are all grown so we will get over it. I was just thinking of telling you what he has done to help. Sounds cheasy but self help books and journaling. He is also in the process of retiring from the military, she's trying to take half of that as well.. he has been looking for lawyers but wants to be fair.

dialog.content: they have a mean spirited way about telling others how to live their life.  I get nervous quite easily.

dialog.content: Two of my school mates said I need to get a part time job with Lyft to support myself.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I am there for my older parents who appreciate me waiting on them a lot, when I am not in classes.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: My elderly parents are very demanding.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: I understand. I can see why this causes you anxiety. No one should decide what we do with our time except ourselves. One thing is trying to help you but if they are insisting in telling you how to do things maybe you should consider stop seeing them, at least for a while.

dialog.content: Do you have a problem with your parents? What are they exactly demanding about?

dialog.content: Blocking them might be a solution.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Who finances that credit card?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I am just wondering what kind of job would please my two friends.  They are ones from childhood, so they know a lot about my life.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: My credit....I finance it.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Luckily, I have my folks at home to support my life goals and they appreciate me buying groceries and doing chores around their house.

dialog.content: Regarding my friends, you ultimately have to decide between them or your personal wellness. You told me that they give you anxiety and they tell you how to live your life. That is by no means a sign of a healthy friendship.

dialog.content: With your parents just try to be a little patient. They are there to support you ultimately.

dialog.speaker: speaker

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: That is something you will have to ultimately do, however. You will have to live by yourself at some point.

dialog.content: What would you do in my position? Get a full-time job and spend less timelooking after my old folks?

dialog.speaker: speaker

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: I would definetely at least satart looking for a part time job. And if your friends keep making you feel uncomfortable, I would cut ties with them.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Yes, but my friends are the only ones who have time to hang out, in a pre-COVID-19 situation.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: They go back decades.  I would feel bad to lose the connection with them forever.

dialog.content: Well, then it's up to you whether you keep seeing them or not.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: You have to decide whether they are someone you need in your life still.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: **Cut them out of my life for a while

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: That could be a good strategy too.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Have you ever had to take care of elderly people for years and years?

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: No, not from my personal experience.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I feel like my anxiety might be due to never getting a break from the two elderly parents.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Well, that is not good to hear.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: That could be it. You can always get the job and move out by yourself. It's not going to be easy, however.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Anyways, do you have any other suggestions? I think it is rough going for sure, for the short-term.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Communicate. With your parents especially. Tell them what you want and how you feel. And regarding your friends, consider taking a break from them or just be open with them if you think it will help you.

situation: I dated someone for about 8 months.We saw each other regularly (at least once a week), had taken some trips together, and had met each other's families.Suddenly i didn't get any messages from this person for a while.Finally he contacted me and told me he was getting married to someone else!At first i was surprised, but then sadness set in.I missed him a lot and also wondered if i had done anything to cause the breakup.It took me a long time (almost a year) to feel better.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Hello!

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Hi

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: What are you up to today?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Just cooking today. It's too cold to do anything else.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: It is nice to cook when it's cold out.  It's foggy and wet where I am.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: What are you cooking?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Cooking a bit pot of chicken soup.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Ahh, one of my favorites to make!  I bet your house smells wonderful.  Do you enjoy cooking?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I do like to cook although I'm not very advanced with it. I just prefer to eat what I can fix rather than order out or buy prepared food very much.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: What do you do to help you survive the months where you cannot get out much due to weather?

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Cooking can be a nice way to ground yourself.  Have you tried really being mindful through the entire process of cooking?  Really connect and take the time to focus on each step.  I find that slowing down to appreciate the tasks that can seem mundane can help with my feelings of isolation during the winter months.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I have found it's also a good time to clean out any clutter that has accumulated around the house and listen to podcasts. Winter is tough though. I sometimes daydream about living in a place that has very little winter like parts of central America.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: I understand that completely. I used to live in a state that got a lot of snow and freezing ice.  Fantasizing about Central America sounds like a good way to pass some time!    Keeping an organized home is helpful to avoid unnecessary stress too, so kudos for staying busy and being constructive.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Do you have a favorite pod cast?  I like Mel Robbins myself.  I seem to be able to relate to what she says.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I will have to look up Mel Robbins -  I haven't heard of that one before. My favorite is Mindscape with Sean Carroll, and also Hidden Brain with Shankar Vedantam.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Those sound interesting.  I'll have to look them up!

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I also have a cat. She is good company when I'm stuck at home.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Cats are wonderful and seemingly magical creatures.  Soft fur, warm bodies, soothing purr... just delightful!

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I think my cat practices mindfulness - she will sit and stare at something intently for a long time before interacting with it.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: zen cat

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: I love that description!  We could learn a lot from our furry friends.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: They definitely have different priorities. Not much concern for finances, status symbols, social media, moving up the ladder, etc.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Yes, and thankfully they don't need more than a warm place to nap and some good food.  Maybe you can share some of your delicious soup with your companion and have a nice snuggle inside out of the cold.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Sounds good, thanks

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Stay warm!  Remember, winter is temporary!  Sunny days will come again!

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: You too!

situation: I am being told my company is cutting my pay by 20%

dialog.speaker: listener

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: I am not sure  .. could you talk to your doctor?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: You said you applied to charities before, who did you apply to?

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Doctors are often able to put you in touch with charities who might be able to help though. Personally I applied to the Citizen's Advice Bureau

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: They were very helpful and did not make me feel any more ashamed than I already did

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I think things may work differently in different places. I'm assuming you are in the UK if you are mentioning the Citizen Advice Bureau. I'm in the United States.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Do they provide financial support?

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Ah I see .. yes I am. They do not provide financial support but they put me in touch with a food bank which was able to help a lot.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Would you be able to take on a second, part time job to make up the difference in salary?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: That might be possible and probably something I will have to do. Either that, or find a cheaper place to live

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: How difficult would it be for you to move at this time?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: It would be but maybe it's necessary. It will certainly add much more stress.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Do you have any family that you could potentially live with for a while?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: not near by they live across the country. but maybe that's what it would take. To move in temporarily with them and find a new job near them

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: I hope that you will be able to do that. Thank  you for talking and I wish you all the best!

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I wish you would have been more helpful. Better luck next time to you.

situation: I am quarantined because of covid-19, and the state has not paid any of my pandemic unemployment assistance yet, so i have no income.Rent is due in a week!

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Hi

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Hi.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: This is going to be one of the toughest holiday seasons in my life.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Yes. It is the toughest holiday for everyone.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: How do you feel today?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I thought it was bad when I lost my Dad around Christmas years ago, but this is worse.  I may not have rent in a week.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I've been home with COVID-19 on quarantine and the state has not paid any of my Pandemic Unemployment Assistance yet.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: My deep condolences for your loss. But it is the fact that people born in this world has to die at some point. It is nature and we can't change it.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: True enough.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: At least when my father passed, I had a safe and comfortable place to live.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: We should not worry about who has left us. But we should make comfort for people who is with us.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I've had about 6 people die this month.  I don't think that'll work for me, but thanks for trying.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Due to Covid-19 most of the people has lost their lives and jobs. In order to survive in this situation we should look for alternative method for earning money.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: We can try works that are done from home. By like Freelancing, etc.,

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I'm too old and unattractive to turn tricks and drugs are too hard to get to try to sell them.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: (Yes, I'm kidding)

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Or you could provide suggestions for the problem they had, which makes everyone relieved from their problems.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Sometimes advice is not welcome, or the best solution.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Advice doesn't pay the rent.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: So then freelancing is the best option to earn money during this COVID-19 situation.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Can't get out if one is positive with COVID-19.  Quarantines and such, ya know?

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: You can signup in websites and you can do you work in side your home. So there is no need of going out.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: It's a thought, but it won't bring in enough money.

dialog.content: By doing the work that posted in their website get's you a payout for that work.

dialog.speaker: listener

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Websites like mturk, crowdworkes, etc., pay you a lot and also on time. You can manage this situation with this money.

dialog.content: Well thanks for the input.  I suppose I should go.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: After the release of lockdown you can get a new job. Ok then are you satisfied with my suggestions.

situation: I did not receive a job promotion.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I am so depressed right now and I don't know what to do.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: What is going on that might be causing the depression?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I got passed over for a promotion that I completely deserved. I worked so hard over the past few years to get the promotion and someone who didn't deserve it got it instead.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Did you ask what you could have done to be passed over for the promjotion?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Yes, and I didn't receive a direct answer. My supervisor basically told me just to keep at it and maybe I will get it next year. But I can't imaging working this hard for another year with only a possibility of getting promoted. I am so depressed and frustrated that I want to cry.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: I understand.  It can be very disappointing to think you will receive something then don't.  Are you otherwise happy with your job?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: No, I'm not happy with my job. I only stayed there because of this promotion. I feel so worthless and stupid. I wasted so much time with this company when I could have been doing other things.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: It wasn't a waste of time.  You have the experience to add to your resume.  Maybe it's time to go out and see what other opportunities are out there for you now.  You are obviously good at your job to have lasted in your position.  Just because you didn't receive the promotion doesn't mean you didn't deserve it.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: But the job market is so bad because of COVID. It's impossible to find a job right now. And I'm not getting any younger.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: You are taking too long to answer. This therapy is not working for me.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: It never hurts to stay where you are right now and submit your resume to other companies you would rather have a position with.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I don't feel like you are understanding how depressed I am.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: I understand how depressed you are.  I was just trying to give you some options to maybe help improve your mood.  You seem to be taking this passover personally as a reflection of your actions or performance but generally it's not the reason for not getting a promotion.  In a lot of instances the problem is company politics or just personal relationships.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: No, I think it's because I am a failure and bad at my job. And I don't think people like me very much.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Why do you think people don't like you very much?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Because I think people at work have been conspiring to not give me the promotion so that I will get discouraged and leave the company.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: What actions have they displayed to make you think this?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: People fom

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: People don't talk to me very much and I don't have any work friends.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: I used to feel as if people didn't like me either.  Then one day I realized maybe if I made the first move things would be different.  I found that by being friendly to others first, they in turn were friendly back.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I've tried to be friendly but it doesn't work. I might as well just give up.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: So you think you were passed over for a promotion because majority of employees don't like you and they want to force you to leave the company?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Yes.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Just from talking to you I can see that you are really upset over this.  I think you need to see that you did your job and not let the reflections of others take anything away from you.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: This is not helping me. Thank you for your time.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: I apologize that I was not able to help you.

situation: He broke up with me out of the blue and i was shocked

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Hello there, how are you feeling at the moment?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Hello. I am feeling numb.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: I am really sorry to hear that, can you tell me a little about your situation?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: My boyfriend broke up with me a few days ago.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Ah I am so sorry. So your relationship ended and this is making your feel bad?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Well, I loved him so much so I can not feel hapiness right now.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: How long were the two of you together?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: We have been together for two years and a half.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: That is a long time. I remember how I felt when my boyfriend of five years left me. It is a horrible feeling.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: You are not helping.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: I am sorry. What could I say that would be of help?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I do not know.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Do you have any friends that  you are able to confide in at this time?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: If I did I would not be here right?

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: I sense that you are feeling hostile and aggressive. This is a normal reaction to a break up.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Why so?

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Because you feel betrayed and angry with the entire world and so you are projecting it.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Would you consider seeing a counsellor?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: How do you know that I feel angry at the world? The word did nothing to me.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: I am only assuming based on how I felt in the same circumstances.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: I apologise if I am not helping.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: You stated that as a fact. I feel even worse now.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Then I feel I am a failure as a counsellor. It was certainly not my intention to make you feel worse. Can you think of anything that might cheer you up?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I was hoping you could help with that but apparently you cannot.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Not it seems that I cannot. Can you think of anything that would make you happy at the moment?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: No.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Did you previously have any hobbies? Do you like to read, or watch films?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Is there a person without hobbies?

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: You tell me.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: That is obvious.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: It was a rethorical qeston.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: question*

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Well, I am sorry that I could have been of more assistance today. I hope that you are able to get some professional help.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Or get a cat. That might work too.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I can not do that.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: I am sorry. Well thanks for talking - sort of - and enjoy the rest of your day.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: I can't quit my end. Feel free to press quit and take the survey.

dialog.content: Can you respond a little quicker? I have other things to do and I just wanted a little support.

situation: My company is currently downsizing and i'm considered about losing my job.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Hello

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Hello, how are you?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I'm ok. Am a bit stressed about work

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Can you tell me more about it?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Sure. Unfortunately, my company is downsizing.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: My department hasn't been reorganized yet, but related departments have been, so it's defintely coming.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Overall, about 30% of company will be laid-off. Am worried about losing my job soon.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: I understand how you feel, it's scary knowing it's gonna happen and have to worry if you'll be among them

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: It's also been a more stressful time given that everyone is being reorganized. Our workloads aren't very sustainability, yet folks are pressured to continued to meet unrealistic deadlines in the midst of all this.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Is there any reason for you to believe you'd be fired?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: There hasn't been much order to the other departments' layoffs. It does seem a bit random.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: So while I think my performance and job function are "safe", prior actions have left me worried.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: What I want to suggest you is, I know it's hard to say "what come will come" and stop worry, however, being in similar situations myself before, I realized there's no point worrying about what hasn't happened. It stresses you out but doesn't make anything better

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: so go on with your life as usual, do your best at work now to prove your value instead of worrying

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: While I understand and agree, it's hard to put that in practice!

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: I know, that's why start little by little, nothing changes if we don't take the first step

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Start by distracting yourself with work and any hobbies you have. Then when you have time, look around for opening jobs , that way you can feel safe knowing you have backup plan

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I think that's easier said than done!

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Do you have specific examples of how to do that?

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: I was like that before, I worry a lot. I still do now, however, anytime I start thinking that way, I ask myself "Does this help me at all?""Will this change the predetermined outcome?". Then I understand I need a more practical approach to my problems

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content:
I hear that,, but it doesn't work for me. I'm not able to just "ignore" the stressor. Especially with something that bleeds into my personal life
.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Have you considered seeking professional help?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I've tried to find a therapist, but none of the ones in my network are accepting new patients. Unfortunatley.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: That's really unfortunate.Do you have anyone that you can talk to about this? Many times I find that being able to share your problems with someone can be very helpful

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I'm able to talk with my partner, but talking only does so much! It's really not helping with day-to-day workdays. They're pretty miserable.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: I think your best option is to start looking for jobs if you don't feel very secure here. Who knows, you might even find a better place before they make any decision regarding your department

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Yeah but it's been tough to job hunt with the hours i'm having to put in. 2 of my teams have lost 50% of their team members- but we still have 100% of the workload. So work has been extra stresfful to meet those demands.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I do need to leave, but appreaciate the chat!

situation: I recently underwent electroconvulsive therapy to alleviate my life-long depression.It worked very well, but it has only been 2 months, and the effects have already worn off.I am experiencing suicidal thoughts again and don't know what to do next.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: hello?

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Hello. What is going on?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I'm just having a lot of suicidal thoughts and feel like i have hit a wall, treatment-wise. I don't feel there's anyone i can talk to about this.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: I understand. You're not feeling that your treatment is working and therefore you're struggling with some negative feelings. Since you're feeling like that your treatment hasn't been effective I would go talk to your treating source and see what other options are available to you.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I mean, I had shock therapy. Literal shock therapy. I can't imagine there are many options beyond that.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: That's why you do need to find someone whether its with you are being treated by at this time or someone else. Sometime's a second opinion can be beneficial.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Yeah, I get that. But it's saturday night. How do I get through the next day? The next hour?

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: There's a number of groups that provide service 24/7.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Ugh. The local crisis line is garbage. And the national hotline is not much better..

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Not talking about local crisis lines or national ones. There's different apps that provide service.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Like what?

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Don't know the actual name yet they're easy to find if you search for them.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Oh.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I know you're not an actual peer-support specialist, but, fyi, that is super unhelpful.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Sorry if you feel that I was unhelpful. I know you're going through things so I'm not going to take it personally. My only other two suggestions that I have for you would be to watch videos that you might find inspiring or reach out to someone you know that you feel comfortable sharing your feelings and where you feel safe.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I have been watching stuff; it helps sometimes, but it's not a panacea. I don't feel like  I have anyone I can talk to. Partly that is my own doing. I push people away. I feel like my illness burdens them.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: I've often felt that way too. Yet I found that there are several people who will.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I don't know. I've isolated myself pretty thouroughly. I mean, I have my partner, who I live with, but he doesn't need my crap, you know? Like, he's got enough to deal with, keeping us afloat.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: It's understandable to feel that way. It can feel like a lot to hand off to someone like your partner. Yet it might be exactly what is needed for you so your partner has a better understanding of what is going on with you.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I supposed that's true. I just hate to have to tell him that yet another treatment has failed, and I'm right back where I started. Especially after the last treatment took 6 weeks, and he had to drive me back and forth to the hospital 2x a week, and lose 2 whole days a week, sitting around, ,waiting for me to get out of recovery, so he could drive me home. I feel like I have already asked so much of him, and it's not fair for me to ask any more.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: If the situations were reversed how would you feel if your partner came to you with how they're feeling and needed your help?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I would drop everything to help him. But i still feel guilty asking for help.

situation: My friends are refusing to take the covid vaccine and i'm very angry about this.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Hi, how are you?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: My friends are refusing to take the covid vaccine and it's very concerning to me.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Oh man, I have friends who are refusing to be tested too.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Is there a concern that they have been exposed?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I've had covid.  I want the vaccine.  I never want to go through that again.  They watched me go through it, so I'm confused and angry that they are not willing to get it.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: is the vaccine available to them already, or are they just refusing to take it when it is available?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: oh no, not yet.  But when it is available they are saying they will not take it.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Have you told them that you are concerned for them?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Yes, they know that I'm very worried about them.  They tell me that I should not be that they will be fine.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: It's good that they know you are concerned about them. That's important for friendships.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: If they refuse to get shots are you still willing to be around them?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: No I don't think so.  If they cannot take care of themselves and protect the people around them, then I just don't know that I can be friends with them anymore.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: At the end of the day, you need to make sure to take care of yourself. And unfortunately sometimes that means separating from people who don't align with your values.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: That's kinda  how I feel.  This has divided so many people it seems.  I hate thinking of losing my friends but it's so selfish to not take the vaccine when it will save thousands of lives.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: The good thing, is that you probably don't need to make any decisions in haste, fortunately due to social distancing, you have time to make those kinds of decisions.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Yes I"m really hoping they change their minds.  It was very scary when I had covid.  I wouldn't want anyone to have to experience that if they don't have to

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: I fully understand, I had it too and it was brutal.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I don't think the government should mandate it, but I do think they should do some things to maybe incentivise people.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: I agree, the coming year will be interesting and likely stressful regarding vaccines. Employers and other organizations may make it mandatory for people to take them. Ultimately you need to do what's best for you

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Yes I have heard that some companies are going to make it mandatory.  i hope that will help somewhat

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Yes your friends may have to be tested.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Tested for Covid?  Well I hope they don't get it or get sick.  But I'd like to see them take the vaccine.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: sorry not tested, I mean get the vaccine.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: They may  be required to take it.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Ah yes, that would definitely help.  I just wish they would come to that realization on their own.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: It may just take them some time. But fortunately we all have time on our sides these days.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Well at least for a little while I guess.  I don't forsee most of us even getting a chance to take it until May or so.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: that's true. It will take a bit for it to become available, and by then your friends may have changed their minds. Hopefully you can keep talking to them about it until then.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I'll keep working at it. I sure hope they do.

dialog.speaker: listener

dialog.content: There are definitely a lot of stressors happening around us now, so anything that happens outside of covid, economy, elections feels more intense than usual.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Getting good rest is definitely important for feeling good.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Well Covid definitely does not help.  I'm very fearful of it so I really don't want to go out (5)

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: have you tried going for walks or any small kind of physical activity?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: No - I'm always afraid I'll run into people and well I just don't 'people' very well (6)

dialog.content: I am the same way. But I've enjoyed wearing masks because people don't know who I am and because of distancing I don't feel obligated to engage with them.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Do you think you'd feel better wearing a mask and going for walks or listening to headphones?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I've never thought of that - maybe I could wear a mask and glasses. (7)

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: I think it could help get you moving and feeling a bit better physically which in turn will crank endorphins through your body and make you feel better mentally too.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: have you ever tried breathing exercises?

dialog.content: It's essentially a meditative practice that allows you to focus on your breathing rather than the stressors in your life. And because you are focused on breathing it'll lower your heartrate and also better oxygenate your blood, thereby reducing your stress and unpleasant feelings. Is that something you think you could try?

dialog.content: Yeah there are many youtube channels that discuss how to do it. also many books. if you do a search for "breathing exercises" or "meditation for stress" you'll find a bunch of resources.

dialog.content: plus youtube is free... so that's a perk!

dialog.content: I'll have to look into it.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Are there any other things bothering you?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Well I do like free - that's another area that depresses me, my money situation

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Yeah I understand money is very stressful especially now with covid and people being laid off. Are you still employed?

situation: I left my partner of 8 years.We have been apart for 9 months and i am still sad.

dialog.content: Happy holidays!

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Same to you! And remember you are never alone when you have the internet ;-)  Just keep reacting out and practicing vulnerabilty and you will find others to help you along this journey called life. Have a great night.

situation: Finals are this week and i'm very nervous about them.I am worried i will not pass.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: hello, im here to listen. how are you doing?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: it's hard - my finals are this week and i'm freaking out

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Finals can be hard, but I think you can do it, what makes you uneasy about them?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I'm uneasy about them mostly because I missed a lot of class due to Covid. I was sick for a long time.  But my professors don't really care.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: So your professors have not indicated any curve to grading do to the pandemic? Have you tried reaching out to a student advocate?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: No, they do not care.  They say that I've had time and that I should have dropped the classes if I couldn't keep up, even though i got sick after drop time.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Take a breath, reflect on what you know, how well do you think you will do on the finals?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Well, I think I'm good on my essays at least.  It's the two finals that I have to go in for - psychology and environmental science.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Just not sure if I'm going to get the grades that I need.  I have to score within a certain percentage to keep my scholarship.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Do you have any peers you could reach out to that might help you in studying for psychology or environmental science?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: not really  - due to covid we really haven't been allowed to socialize so I don't know anyone in the class that I could ask.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: I have been chatting with many students and you're not alone in the way your feeling, many students are expressing uncertainty in how they will perform in this round of finals due to covid. The best course of action is to try your best, you may surprise yourself.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I hope that is what happens.  I just can't seem to calm myself down about it.  It's so bad I've been feeling nauseous.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: I find stepping back from a problem can really help with anxious feelings. Have you ever practiced yoga or meditation?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: No I guess I could try that.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Give it a try, if its not for you at least now you know what doesn't work.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: That's true - somethings gotta give here soon.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: I often found myself anxious before finals, I found that often the build up to the exam was far worse and usually the exam was much easier than I had built it up to be in my head.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I'm praying that's the case for me this go round.  Next semester will not be this hectic and worrisome.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: That is true

situation: I have finals this week.I am very worried and nervous about them.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I have finals this week and I'm very worried.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: I am sorry to hear that, what worries you about your finals?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Well mostly that I will not do well on them.  I'm still recovering from being sick and my energy is just not back up to normal yet.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: I see so it seems that you are worrying that you will not be well enough to focus on these am i understanding your correctly?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Yes or that I may have missed something important while I was sick.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Have you spoking to your professors about this?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Yes but they don't really care.  Finals cannot be pushed off or rescheduled just for me.  They were not very nice about it.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Do you have any class mates you could maybe get in touch with to help you go over the information just to be sure you have not missed anything?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Not really.  I don't know anyone in the class and because we have to social distance, I really haven't gotten to know anyone.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Yes I could see how that can make things difficult.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Yep, so I'm kinda on my own with this and I just cannot seem to calm myself down so that I can work on the three papers that are due and study for the 2 tests.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Do you think your professors would be willing to have a video chat with you at some point just to go over anything of importance you may have missed?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I highly doubt it.  I guess they figure you've been in a big university for at least a year that this isn't your freshman year and so they are just not very helpful.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: You could try laying down for awhile maybe taking a nap and coming back with a fresh mind and focus on your papers.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Try not to think about anything else while writing your papers. After that study what you have already learned and try not to stress what you may not know, i am sure you have learned enough to pass them.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I've done that a few times.  The problem there is that I don't get back up in time to work - then I've lost more than just an hour.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Have you tried setting a alarm to ensure you do not over sleep?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Yes, but even if I get up I'm so groggy for the next hour or so.  It just doesn't work for me to take naps during the day.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Have you tried a nice relaxing bath? Or maybe meditating those things usually help me to clear my mind and focus better.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I have not tried those things.  Perhaps that might work.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: A hot bath with soft music on is the best when i feel stressed, i would try that and come back refreshed and focus on one task at a time. I am sure you will do fine, try not to stress it, it could make you feel worse.

situation: I found out that my best friend kissed my boyfriend once i left a party the other day.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Hello, how are you?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Hi there.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I've been better. Feeling pretty angry today, at my best friend in particular

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Yeah?  What'd they do?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: There was a party the other day and I left early because I wasn't feeling well. Low and behold, I found out today that once I left my best friend kissed my boyfriend!

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Hmm.  How old are you all?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Between the ages of 27 and 29

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Well, you're a little too old to blame it on kids being silly.  How about alcohol?  Maybe we can chalk it up to that?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content:
Exactly. I was planning a future with this man and he so recklessly threw it away.

There was definitely alcohol involved but that's no excuse

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Honestly though, I'm more angry at my friend. We've known each other for 20 years. I can't believe she did that

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Are you really going to toss your future over some kissing?  I mean come on, yes it''s annoying but is it really that big of a deal?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content:
Yes I am. He cheated, plain and simple, and more importantly he didn't tell me (nor did she)
. I had to find out through a mutual friend who saw it.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Well, personally I've got a different take on these things, I have kind of a slutty lifestyle.   All I can say though, is that in general when anything like this happens in life, I look at it like so,..   Whatever the issue is has already taken place, nothing I do at this point is going to change that, so really it's just up to me how to react to it.  I can either get all upset and be in a bad mood, or shrug it off and go on about my business.  Maybe that's just me though.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I think I'm allowed to be upset and hurt and angry by what they've done

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Well sure, but past a certain point is that really doing you any good?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I get your point but this just happened. It's not like I'm still brooding 2 years later

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: That's fair.   I guess all I'm saying is that I think I'd take a deep breath and cool down for a few days.   I mean you've known this woman for 20 years.   No question she was out of line, but that's a lot of friendship to throw away over some kissing.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Well, it's not like she told me the truth or even apologized. So is that the kind of "friend" I want in my life?

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Well that's a fair point too.   I think you're right to judge her more harshly.   Let's take the kissing out of it.  Let's just find her guilty of a generic fuck up, she still ought to have the class to apologize.   Have you ever seen any sign of her being shitty like this before?  I mean is this out of character for her?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: It's out of character to some degree but she's always been pretty selfish

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Hmm, well maybe it's time to reevaluate her place in your life.   You're the only one who can make that call I'd think.   As for the boyfriend, I suppose if you want you can have some fun making him work his way out of the doghouse.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I guess...

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: To be honest, I'm not sure this is helping much so I'm going to go

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Take care

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: alright, see you later.  good luck

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: How do we finish this up then?

situation: My teenage daughter throws tantrums occasionally about her not liking when my boyfriend is around.He went out to dinner with us this weekend and today she told me it angered her.He was at my house so i asked him to go home.This creates a lot of stress on my relationship with him

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: hi

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Hello, there how are you doing today?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: i'm a little upset.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Do you want to talk about why you are upset?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content:
sure.
i am dating someone. we have been gating on and off for 5 years. he's a nice guy. he was at my house this weekend and my teenage daughter threw a fit. i had to ask him to leave. when we have taken breaks in the past it's because he thinks i don't spend enough time with him

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Why did your daughter throw a fit?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: she said she wanted to hang out with me. i believe she feels that way but she was welcome to hang out with the two of us, pick a movie that we all could watch but she didn't want that. most of the time she just wants to know i'm there sitting doing nothing in case she decides she wants me for something.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Hmm, it seems like your daughter has a problem with you dating? Maybe its time to have a serious talk with her about your life. I am a single father to a younger daughter as well. Its tough.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: i don't mean to sound unloving. i am a very attentive and doting parent and have always put my children first. she is now 16 and seldom wants me but does not like the idea that i may want to spend time with him. you are right about the talk. when we discuss this i typically cut back the amount of time i spend with my boyfriend and then he get annoyed. i genuinely like him but have to put my children first. my son is a freshman in college and my daughter is a junior in high school. i don't want to be childish but i would like a little something for myself.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: No, you dont sound unloving at all. It must of come off as wrong. You have the right to a life. You seem to be very caring and supportive of your daughter. You have to make her realize that you will be there for her always but you need to be able to explore your own life as well.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Thats the talk i was implying before. Its always going to be tough striking a balance but if you feel you arent spending enough time with your boyfriend, she needs to understand that.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: i didn't do that for years. i divorced an abusive husband and needed to give my children a stable home. i was always involved with my children. about 4 years ago i started dating someone. i tried to keep everything very compartmentalized. i don't like disappointing anyone and i do feel my first commitment is to my children. i sound like a baby. i appreciate your agreement about striking a balance.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Oh you dont sound like a baby, your previous relationship made making new ones very hard. You dont want your kids to feel abandoned. I completely understand. I think that message that you will be there needs to be verbalized more.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: you are right. i do love my boyfriend. he is a good guy. it's not fair to expect him to sit around and wait. it's not fair to upset my daughter. i get nervous that they will both be gone soon since they are growing up. i don't want to be alone. and i know if i step back for any length of time my boyfriend will get frustrated.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Yeah rough place to be. Maybe a sit down with all three of you? Or individually first then together?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: i think that's like sucker-punching my daughter. he was understanding today when i sent him home. i have always been honest with him that my children come first. his children are a little older and he's not as child-centric as i am. i will talk to my daughter. i hate the thought of upsetting her or making her feel like she doesn't come first. but really i just want her to be more understanding and i don't know if she is capable of that.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: thank you for the perspective.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: I let you know right now it will be upsetting to her, and i understand from what you have been through you dont want too upset her further. This though will be a learning moment for her, It will also help her develop healthy relationships in the future

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: i never thought about this would effect her in the future. i guess i'm going to have a tough talk soon.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: I think theres a light at the end of this tunnel though. Will be rough, but worth it.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: here's to hoping you're right.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Im routing for you!

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: thank you! you're very kind.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Oh not a problem at all!

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: now i just have to psych myself up for the talk. thank you again.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: You are very welcome!

situation: The dsm-5 lists two general categories of mood disorders.Depressive disorders are a group of disorders in which depression is the main feature.Depression is a vague term that, in everyday language, refers to an intense and persistent sadness.Depression is a heterogeneous mood state—it consists of a broad spectrum of symptoms that range in severity.Depressed people feel sad, discouraged, and hopeless.These individuals lose interest in activities once enjoyed, often experience a decrease in drives such as hunger and sex, and frequently doubt personal worth.Depressive disorders vary by degree, but this chapter highlights the most well-known: major depressive disorder (sometimes called unipolar depression).Bipolar and related disorders are a group of disorders in which mania is the defining feature.Mania is a state of extreme elation and agitation.When people experience

situation: While moods are commonly used to describe how an individual person feels at a given time, they also can be used to describe the atmosphere of groups of people, places, and eras or time periods.When describing how a group is feeling, a collective mood is often used.For example, if something unfair happens in the workplace and a group of employees lost their jobs, this group's mood can be described as frustrated and enraged.If a group of students gets to go on a fun field trip for the day instead of sitting in the classroom, the mood can be described as excited or elated.Descriptive writing can be used to set the mood of a place.When describing a place, you will want to add plenty of detail and use vivid words.For example, if writing about a beach use words such as salty sea air, gentle breeze, soft sand, lapping waves or warm sun rays.The mood set for this beach is calm and peaceful.When referring to a period of time or specific era, moods can be used to set the scene.Use wo

When i became homeless and was sleeping in my car. I had to sell everything. I bought a burner phone and a po box so i could apply anywhere. Tough times call for tough sacrifices.
