dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Ehh, I don't think you're overanalyzing this. I've dealt with a similar problem with my boyfriend.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Really. what happened?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Are you still there?

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Yes, I'm still here

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: How did you deal with her similar issue with your boyfriend. I'm Keen to know what worked for you?

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: I felt like my boyfriend and I were becoming distant towards each other, and I told him my concerns about our relationship. He was very attentive to my concerns and assured me that our relationship was very important to him.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content:
That's interesting. For me I don't think we have grown apart. It so just that I don't feel the same way I used to. I find myself looking at other women more, which makes me feel bad because I love her. Is that normal? am I a
 bad person?

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: You're not a bad person for looking at other women, but I would consider expressing your concerns about your relationship to your girlfriend.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: That sounds like a challenging conversation to have. Any tips you could suggest so that she doesn't go absolutely off the wall :-)#

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: my immediate impression is that I don't have your full attention.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: I apologize, I'm just trying to think of a good solution for you

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: I don't know that I would mention looking at other women, and try to reassure her about how you still love her

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Yes I think that's good advice but also I'm starting to think if I actually do love her? I mean I think I do, maybe it's just the length of time we spent together. perhaps I'm thinking too deeply about it?

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: From what I've read, it does seem that you do love her and you're trying to improve your relationship with her.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: yeah I'm reflecting, I think it's just the length of time we spent together but I just wondered if this was a common thing that people experience in relationships?

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: I do think this is a common thing most couples go through.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Ok that's great. Thanks for the advice

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: You're welcome!

situation: Not sure what i want to pursue in life

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Yes. I would.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Great! Research shows that if you put your mind at any activity for 10 minutes a day for 3 weeks continuously, the activity becomes a hobby!

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I see. So if I were to practice the guitar for 10 minutes a day for 3 weeks, it would become a hobby? Well then, how would that help me get out of my mundane routine?

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Good question and a nice example. So, let's take your example and say you start practising Guitar for 10 minutes a day and after 3 weeks you are doing something you enjoy. Once you get to this point, you can look at joining a local band or finding people with similar interests in your locality. This way, once you expand your social circle, you would have something to look forward to everyday apart from work. Is this something that would work with your life?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I see. Yes, this is something I think I will try. Thank you so much for your helpful words!

situation: I'm getting older and have been facing the fact that i'm probably going to be alone for the rest of my life, with no career or partner.I tried to get an education and meet new people, but i get rejected every time.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: hey friend! how are you doing?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Hello, I'm feeling kind of depressed right now. Thanks for listening.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: I hear you, you got some sadness. Would you be willing to say more about that?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Did you read my description above?

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: description? all i got was your first message of 'hello im feeling kind of depressed right now. thanks for listening."

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I thought you could read what's in the pink box that I see in my view. It says, I'm getting older and have been facing the fact that I'm probably going to be alone for the rest of my life, with no career or partner.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Ah, I cannot see that information. Thank you for your vulnerable share, that sounds like a lot to hold.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: You're welcome.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Is there anything that you want to get out this connection?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: The base payment plus a bonus.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Ah, just the money then? No reassurance, inner strength, proof that love is real, positive feelings?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Not in the form of cliches. They don't do anything for me.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Ok, no cliches, I'll try to steer clear of those. Would you be willing to tell me your age?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I don't see why that's necessary.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Well I'd just use it as some logic-fodder to bust that story in your head, that you are going to be ALONE for the rest of your life. Thats simply a story. What are the facts?

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: My brain really like to predict the future based on the past, but facts and truth are whats real. Whats true for you?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: The facts are, I've tried to connect with people in many different ways and have failed. People are indifferent to me even though I put myself out there. It gets old getting rejected all the time.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Mmmmm, I hear you. Why even try if all I get is silence? Why be vulnerable if all I get is the cold indifference?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Right.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Tell me, if you could connect and have it succeed, what would it look like?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: It would look like two friends or partners enjoying each other's company, eating together, watching TV together, playing sports together, etc.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: beautiful. so connection, to you, is someone to share an experience with?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: For one, yes.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: How else do you connect?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Thank you for your time, I'm going to head out for right now. Have a nice rest of your day.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Ok. Thank you for sharing this space with me. Know that you are worthy of love and support, and that story in your head? its a rough draft waiting to be changed and written :)

situation: My wife left me after 15 years of marriage

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Hi, I could use a helping hand.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: How can I help you today?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I don't know what to do. After 15 years of marriage my wife just left me.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: That sounds terrible. What exactly happened?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Ever since the pandemic I have been working from home and I noticed that my wife has been getting a lot of texts and she then leaves the room. Finally I confronted her about it and she admitted she's been sick and tired of having me at home all the time and she left me.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: It sounds like the chance in circumstances really put a stress on your relationship.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: She says I'm not giving her space and she needs to breathe. But I give her her space.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Why do you think she feels this way then?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I have no idea

dialog.content: Perhaps you could try going to relationship therapy?

dialog.speaker: speaker

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Perhaps look into government assisted help?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Unfortunately because of the pandemic, our local and state governments have no funding for community based programs. We don't have a free psych clinic or anything.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: You can't change peoples feelings. Perhaps a break will clarify things for the both of you.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: So I should just go ahead and get a divorce??? After 15 years of marriage???

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: It sounds like your wife no longer loves you, and you are poor. It might be the best option.

dialog.content: So just like that?? What kind of help is this?

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: I can't make your wife love you. Just from chatting with you, you seem like an angry soul.

dialog.speaker: speaker

dialog.content: Anger is common during a pandemic. Perhaps you could seek some online meditation advice, which is free.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Any suggestions on which ones?

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Try using Google

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: You don't have any resources that have that information?

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: I am not an expert on these things. There are many free resources available on the internet if you are willing to put the effort in and find them.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: So it is up to me then? I came here looking for some support and I have not gotten much of any from you.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: I can only point you in the right direction. If you are not willing to do any work yourself you will never accomplish anything. Perhaps this is what has caused such a breakdown in your marriage?

situation: Both my parents are alcoholics.They separated, my dad is super controlling and abusive while he drinking.He screams and yells and basically just gets out of control hell spend all him money and alcohol, literally not joking.Anyway, my mom on the other hand has never really been a mother figure.She is constantly in her room barely seeing her during the day and night.Mean while i take care of the house, do dishes, the cleaning, laundry and take care of my brother.When she drinks she becomes 14 year old who found the alcohol for the first time.She all over the place and has passed out im pretty sure in every room of the house.With out pants, she recently met this guy who has been coming around.She stopped pay for bills and nagging my brother and i for any money we have, so she can save her money to spend on her boyfriend.Super frustrating and believe me ive tried so mush the only thing to completely get away from it all would be to move.We have no other family willing to help.

dialog.content: Hi! What would you like to talk about today?

dialog.content: I see, have you discussed with them how them coming after you makes you feel?

situation: Constantly under pressure to perform in academics to land a good job & was always afraid of going jobless.This kind of fear got exaggerated to the extent of suicidal thoughts.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I've been unable to control my mind. Too many negative thoughts coming to mind.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: when did this start?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: since last 6 months

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: I also struggled with that! until I met with a therapist and talking it through helped

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: ok, can you please elaborate what kind of therapist? only talking with him/her helped or you had to adopt some other methods too?

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: From my experience, journaling has helped. My therapist introduced me to many coping methods

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: being a peer-supporter now, what can you suggest as an immediate way to resolve this in my life?

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: my best suggestion is to reframe your negative thoughts by writing down what you are feeling and the emotions you feel triggered the negative feelings. this way you will understand your triggers

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: makes sense, that should be helpful

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: I hope so!

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: how do you usually motivate peers in your surroundings who are faced with similar situations?

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: I know it is hard, encourage your friends and tell them about the coping mechanisms

situation: I recently went through a bitter divorce that came completely by surprise.I didn't even think we were unhappy, and now i have to completely change my life in my mid 30s.It's so hard, and very depressing to start over again at this age.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Hello.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Hello, how are you doing today?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I'm hanging in there. How about yourself?

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Not too bad fortunately. What brings you here today?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I recently went through a divorce that I didn't even see coming, nor did my family or friends. It's just really hard to have to completely start over from scratch in my mid 30s. It's very sudden, and saddening, and confusing.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: That's a huge life change right there. Feeling sad and confused is probably the most natural reaction I would imagine.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Definitely. I don't want to be naive or in denial about it. I'm facing the situation head on.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Sometimes it's all you can do. The loss of a partner in any capacity tends to make you confused about your own self assurance and worth. It tends to be a time for deep introspection.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: What kind of introspection do you mean, and how do you suggest I go about it?

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Well I've only had a couple big heartbreaks in my life, but I personally took the time afterward to analyze just about every aspect of the relationships. Trying to understand the reasons on both our parts for things not working out.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I'm not entirely sure how thinking about what I could have done better changes things or fixes things. I'd rather focus on the future than on the past.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: How would you like to move forward?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: I'd like to break things down into smaller pieces and tackle them individually, rather than trying to face everything altogether head on. Make things more manageable. And I'd like to focus on more than just a relationship. That was only a part of things.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: That sounds like a great start. Even if it's just small things, setting appropriate goals and meeting them in the short term always feels good.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Thanks. I feel good about that strategy. It's helping keep me a little more sane.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: What would you work on in the short term?

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: Paying off debts, saving for a small house for myself (I don't want to rent), mending friendships, and perhaps exploring therapy. Sound like anything is missing?

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Those all sound smart to me. The only suggestion I'd offer is moving up the self-care on your priority list. There's no shame in it, and it could help more than you'd expect. Even if it's as simple as having someone lend an ear.

dialog.speaker: speaker
dialog.content: For sure. I appreciate hearing that. That's very true.

dialog.speaker: listener
dialog.content: Well you sound like a smart person, but even smart people have a hard time accepting a little help every now and then.

dialog.speaker: listener

dialog.speaker: speaker

dialog.content: Puzzles are a great way to reduce stress, and it could also keep you busy so that you are not eating out of boredom. Maybe that would help you
